ARABIC: ٱذْهَبُوا۟ بِقَمِيصِى هَٰذَا فَأَلْقُوهُ عَلَىٰ وَجْهِ أَبِى يَأْتِ بَصِيرًا وَأْتُونِى بِأَهْلِكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Go with this shirt of mine and cast it on my father's face and he will see again. Then come to me with all your families.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Take my shirt and put it on my father's face; his eyesight will be restored; and bring your entire family to me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Take this shirt of mine and throw it over my father's face. He will regain his sight. And bring to me all your family."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Take my shirt and place it unto my father's face. This will restore his eye-sight. Then bring the whole family to me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Take along this shirt of mine and lay it on my father’s face, his vision will be restored; and bring your entire household to me.” (Prophet Yusuf knew that this miracle would occur.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Go with this shirt of mine, and cast it over the face of my father, his vision will return, and bring to me all your family."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Take this my shirt and cast it on my father's face, he will (again) be able to see, and come to me with all your families.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Go, take this shirt, and do you cast it on my father's face, and he shall recover his sight; then bring me your family all together.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Go with this shirt of mine and lay it on my father's face, he will become (again) a seer; and come to me with all your folk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Go with this shirt of mine and cast it upon my father's face. He will recover his sight; thereupon come [back] to me with all your family."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Go with this shirt of mine and cast it upon my father's face; he shall become clear-sighted; and bring unto me all your household.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Take this shirt of mine, and cast it upon my father’s face; he will regain his sight, and bring me all your folks.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Go with this my shirt, and cast it over the face of my father: he will come to see (clearly). Then come ye (here) to me together with all your family."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Go with this shirt of mine, and cast it over the face of my father, he will become clear-sighted, and bring to me all your family."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Go, take this shirt of mine and cast it over my father's face, he will recover his sight. Then return to me with all your family'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “Take this shirt of mine, and lay it over my father’s face, and he will recover his sight. And bring your whole family to me.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Take this, my shirt, and cast it over the face of my father; he will become seeing. And bring me your family, all together."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [12:93] He [Joseph] asked them about his father; and they told him that his eyesight had gone. And so he said: Go with this shirt of mine — and this was the shirt of Abraham, the one he wore when he was thrown into the fire; he [Joseph] had it around his neck when he was at the bottom of the well. It [the shirt] had come from Paradise: Gabriel commanded him [Joseph] to send it off [to Jacob] saying that the scent of Paradise lingers in it, and whenever it is cast upon a sufferer, it heals him — and lay it on my father’s face, and he will recover his sight; and bring me all your folk’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Go with this shirt of mine) and his shirt was from Paradise (and lay it on my father's face, he will become (again) a seer) he will regain his sight; (and come to me with all your folk) they were about seventy people.
